seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS system procedure

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS system procedure

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</codeph> system procedure updates the cardinality statistics, or creates the statistics if they do not exist, for the index that you specify or for all of the indexes on a table.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</codeph> system procedure updates the cardinality statistics, or creates the statistics if they do not exist, for the index that you specify or for all of the indexes on a table.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</codeph> system procedure updates the cardinality statistics, or creates the statistics if they do not exist, for the index that you specify or for all of the indexes on a table.

target.mrk: system procedures

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS system procedure

seg-source.mrk: statistics

target.mrk: statistics

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS system procedure

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS system procedure

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses cardinality statistics to determine the optimal query plan during the compilation of a query. If the statistics are missing, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> might use a query plan which is not the most efficient plan.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses cardinality statistics to determine the optimal query plan during the compilation of a query.
If the statistics are missing, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> might use a query plan which is not the most efficient plan.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses cardinality statistics to determine the optimal query plan during the compilation of a query.
If the statistics are missing, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> might use a query plan which is not the most efficient plan.

trans-unit.source: Once statistics have been created, they should be maintained. It is a good idea to call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</codeph> procedure when the number of distinct values in an index is likely to have changed significantly. To drop all existing statistics and start again from scratch, call the <codeph><xref href="rrefdropstatsproc.dita#rrefdropstatsproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS</xref></codeph> system procedure.

seg-source.mrk: Once statistics have been created, they should be maintained.
It is a good idea to call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</codeph> procedure when the number of distinct values in an index is likely to have changed significantly.
To drop all existing statistics and start again from scratch, call the <codeph><xref href="rrefdropstatsproc.dita#rrefdropstatsproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS</xref></codeph> system procedure.

target.mrk: Once statistics have been created, they should be maintained.
It is a good idea to call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS</codeph> procedure when the number of distinct values in an index is likely to have changed significantly.
To drop all existing statistics and start again from scratch, call the <codeph><xref href="rrefdropstatsproc.dita#rrefdropstatsproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_STATISTICS</xref></codeph> system procedure.

trans-unit.source: For more information on cardinality statistics, see "Working with cardinality statistics" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information on cardinality statistics, see "Working with cardinality statistics" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information on cardinality statistics, see "Working with cardinality statistics" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

trans-unit.source: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128), IN INDEXNAME VARCHAR(128))

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128), IN INDEXNAME VARCHAR(128))

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128), IN INDEXNAME VARCHAR(128))

trans-unit.source: You can specify <userinput>null</userinput> for the INDEXNAME to update any existing statistics and create statistics for those statistics that are missing.

seg-source.mrk: You can specify <userinput>null</userinput> for the INDEXNAME to update any existing statistics and create statistics for those statistics that are missing.

target.mrk: You can specify <userinput>null</userinput> for the INDEXNAME to update any existing statistics and create statistics for those statistics that are missing.

seg-source.mrk: Execute privileges

target.mrk: Execute privileges

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, all users have execute privileges on this procedure. However, in order for the procedure to run successfully on a given table, the user must be the owner of either the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database</xref> or the schema in which the table resides. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, all users have execute privileges on this procedure.

However, in order for the procedure to run successfully on a given table, the user must be the owner of either the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database</xref> or the schema in which the table resides.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, all users have execute privileges on this procedure.

However, in order for the procedure to run successfully on a given table, the user must be the owner of either the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database</xref> or the schema in which the table resides.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the system procedure updates statistics for the index PAY_DESC on the SAMP.EMPLOYEE table:

seg-source.mrk: In the following example, the system procedure updates statistics for the index PAY_DESC on the SAMP.EMPLOYEE table:

target.mrk: In the following example, the system procedure updates statistics for the index PAY_DESC on the SAMP.EMPLOYEE table:

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS('SAMP','EMPLOYEE','PAY_DESC');

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS('SAMP','EMPLOYEE','PAY_DESC');

trans-unit.source: In the following example, <userinput>null</userinput> is specified instead of an index name. For all of the indexes, the existing statistics are updated and statistics are created for any missing statistics on the EMPLOYEE table in the SAMP schema.

seg-source.mrk: In the following example, <userinput>null</userinput> is specified instead of an index name.
For all of the indexes, the existing statistics are updated and statistics are created for any missing statistics on the EMPLOYEE table in the SAMP schema.

target.mrk: In the following example, <userinput>null</userinput> is specified instead of an index name.
For all of the indexes, the existing statistics are updated and statistics are created for any missing statistics on the EMPLOYEE table in the SAMP schema.

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS('SAMP', 'EMPLOYEE', null);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_STATISTICS('SAMP', 'EMPLOYEE', null);
